title: Are quantum particles objects of the 4 dimensional reality passing through our 3 dimensional space? - Quora

response.answer_text: Your question is so naive I want to help you; in physics, a dimension is a metric, a means to measure certain attributes of physical reality. The first three dimensions are spatial, the 4th is temporal. They are only numbers, not realms, as the word “dimension” is so often used in fiction. The word ‘reality’ means the condition of being real, or, it exists. Either something you are thinking about exists or it is nothing, not real, does not exist, just your imagination playing tricks on you. A dimension does not “exist” in the way that real things, materials, substances, forces, fields, exist. The word ‘particle’ is a holdover from when physics knew nothing about the quantum realm. In the description of the quantum realm described by QFT, there are no particles, just quantum excitations of the field. These objects / events do not ‘pass through’ reality, they are acting in the one and only reality that exists, but from our point of view of these objects / events, they operate at the scale of sub-atomics, like electrons, quarks, gluons. All four dimensions can be used to measure their transient properties.

Evidence of quantum particles passing through our 4D universe may be dark energy, dark matter, neutrinos and virtual particles. Also, the mysterious weakness of gravity, which is of the fabric of space made of particles, may also indicate quantum particles indirectly and partly interacting in 4D space. Neither of these directly interact with matter or 4D space.

No, quanta (they aren’t really “particles”) such as photons, electrons, and atoms, exist in our ordinary three dimensions plus time, just as surely as tables and apples exist in three dimensions plus time. For more details, see: • my non-technical book Tales of the Quantum (Oxford University Press, 2017). • “There are no particles, there are only fields,” Am. J. Phys., Vol. 81, p. 211-233 (Mar. 2013). • "Electrons as field quanta," Am. J. of Phys., Vol. 73, p. 630 (July 2005). • “Realistic analysis of six controversial quantum issues” in Mario Bunge: A Centenary Festschrift, edited by Michael R. Matthews (Springer 2019), Chp. 19, pp 329-348.

There is no 4th- spatial dimension. All regions in space are 3 dimensional. But the universe has many energy levels and we are in the 2nd energy-level now. You call it the 4th dimension and we notice the climate change and Global warming happening.
Please explain our question. what do you think the string of words “objects of the 4 dimensional reality” mean. sounds like you have some deep insight, but I have no idea what you are asking.
No. Quantum particles are just particles passing through three-dimensional space, although in quantum mechanics we often work in space-time which has three physical dimensions and one time dimension.
